Package org.ejbca.core.protocol.cmp

Class CrmfRequestMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejbca.core.protocol.cmp.BaseCmpMessage
      • org.ejbca.core.protocol.cmp.CrmfRequestMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, RequestMessage, ICrmfRequestMessage
    public class CrmfRequestMessage
extends BaseCmpMessage
implements ICrmfRequestMessage
    Certificate request message (crmf) according to RFC4211. - Supported POPO: -- raVerified (null), i.e. no POPO verification is done, it should be configurable if the CA should allow this or require a real POPO -- Self signature, using the key in CertTemplate, or POPOSigningKeyInput (name and public key), option 2 and 3 in RFC4211, section "4.1. Signature Key POP"
    Version:
    $Id: CrmfRequestMessage.java 26542 2017-09-14 10:36:30Z anatom $
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • id_regCtrl_protocolEncrKey

        public static final org.bouncycastle.asn1.ASN1ObjectIdentifier id_regCtrl_protocolEncrKey

    • Constructor Detail

      • CrmfRequestMessage

        public CrmfRequestMessage()

      • CrmfRequestMessage

        public CrmfRequestMessage​(org.bouncycastle.asn1.cmp.PKIMessage pkiMessage,
                          String defaultCADN,
                          boolean allowRaVerifyPopo,
                          String extractUsernameComponent)
        Parameters:
        pkiMessage - PKIMessage
        defaultCADN - possibility to enforce a certain CA, instead of taking the CA subject DN from the request, if set to null the CA subject DN is taken from the request
        allowRaVerifyPopo - true if we allows the user/RA to specify the POP should not be verified
        extractUsernameComponent - Defines which component from the DN should be used as username in EJBCA. Can be CN, UID or nothing. Null means that the username should have been pre-set, or that here it is the same as CN.

      • getRequestPublicKey

        public PublicKey getRequestPublicKey()
                              throws InvalidKeyException,
                                     NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                     NoSuchProviderException
        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage
        Get the key from a certification request.
        Specified by:
        getRequestPublicKey in interface RequestMessage
        Returns:
        The key from a certification request. Returns null if request content hasn't been set, or there is no public key in the request (can be ok if server generated keys are requested).
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - If the key is invalid.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the key uses an unhandled algorithm.
        NoSuchProviderException - if there is an error with the Provider.

      • getRequestSubjectPublicKeyInfo

        public org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.SubjectPublicKeyInfo getRequestSubjectPublicKeyInfo()
        Description copied from interface: ICrmfRequestMessage
        Gets a SubjectPublicKeyInfo form the request. This is separate from the RequestMessage.getRequestPublicKey(), because the SubjectPublicKeyInfo can be empty, contain only and algorithmIdentifier in case when server generated keys are requested.
        Specified by:
        getRequestSubjectPublicKeyInfo in interface ICrmfRequestMessage
        Returns:
        SubjectPublicKeyInfo, with the same public key as getRequestPublicKey, or null, or only an algorithmIdentifier.

                                    NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                    NoSuchProviderException
        Description copied from interface: ICrmfRequestMessage

        Specified by:

        NoSuchAlgorithmException - Fail
        NoSuchProviderException - Fail

      • getSubjectCertSerialNo

        public BigInteger getSubjectCertSerialNo()
        Gets a requested certificate serial number of the subject. This is a standard field in the CertTemplate in the request. However the standard RFC 4211, section 5 (CertRequest syntax) says it MUST not be used. Requesting custom certificate serial numbers is a very non-standard procedure anyhow, so we use it anyway.
        Returns:
        BigInteger the requested custom certificate serial number or null, normally this should return null.

        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage

        Returns:
        requested DN or null.

      • getRequestValidityNotBefore

        public Date getRequestValidityNotBefore()
        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage
        Gets a validity date from the request, if the request contains a desired validity. The requested validity may, or may not be used, it depends if allowValidityOverride is set in the certificate profile.
        Specified by:
        getRequestValidityNotBefore in interface RequestMessage
        Returns:
        A date now or in the future for notBefore validity in the certificate, or null if no desired validity is in the certificate.

      • getRequestValidityNotAfter

        public Date getRequestValidityNotAfter()
        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage
        Gets a validity date from the request, if the request contains a desired validity. The requested validity may, or may not be used, it depends if allowValidityOverride is set in the certificate profile.
        Specified by:
        getRequestValidityNotAfter in interface RequestMessage
        Returns:
        A date in the future for notAfter validity in the certificate, or null if no desired validity is in the certificate.

      • getRequestExtensions

        public org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.Extensions getRequestExtensions()
        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage
        Gets any requested extensions, if the request message type is able to contain request extensions and if there are any. Requested extensions are (currently) in the form of X509Extensions.
        Specified by:
        getRequestExtensions in interface RequestMessage
        Returns:
        X509Extensions or null

      • verify

        public boolean verify()
               throws InvalidKeyException,
                      NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                      NoSuchProviderException
        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage
        Verifies signatures, popo etc on the request message. If verification fails the request should be considered invalid.
        Specified by:
        verify in interface RequestMessage
        Returns:
        true if verification was successful, false if it failed.
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - If the key used for verification is invalid.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the signature on the request is done with an unhandled algorithm.
        NoSuchProviderException - if there is an error with the Provider.

      • requireKeyInfo

        public boolean requireKeyInfo()
        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage
        indicates if this message needs recipients and private key to verify, decrypt etc. If this returns true, setKeyInfo() should be called.
        Specified by:
        requireKeyInfo in interface RequestMessage
        Returns:
        True if and private key is needed.

      • setKeyInfo

        public void setKeyInfo​(Certificate cert,
                       PrivateKey key,
                       String provider)
        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage
        Sets the and private key needed to decrypt/verify the message. Must be set if requireKeyInfo() returns true.
        Specified by:
        setKeyInfo in interface RequestMessage
        Parameters:
        cert - certificate containing the key.
        key - private key.
        provider - the provider to use, if the private key is on a HSM you must use a special provider. If null is given, the default BC provider is used.
        See Also:
        RequestMessage.requireKeyInfo()

        Specified by:

        Returns:

        public boolean includeCACert()
        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage
        If the CA certificate should be included in the response or not, default to true = yes. Not applicable for all request/response types.
        Specified by:
        includeCACert in interface RequestMessage
        Returns:
        true or false

      • getRequestType

        public int getRequestType()
        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage
        Sometimes (CMP) the response identifier sent depends on which request identifier was used, even if the messages themselves are the same messages.
        Specified by:
        getRequestType in interface RequestMessage
        Returns:
        which type of request message this response is in response to

        Description copied from interface: RequestMessage

        Specified by:
        getRequestId in interface RequestMessage
        Returns:
        the id from the request matching to this response

        Specified by:
        setResponseKeyInfo in interface RequestMessage
        Parameters:
